headline.main: FROM KANSAS.; Startling News from the Plains--Bold Attempt at Murder and Robbery-Kansas Affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are sensible people in Boston. They have on hand a Fourth of July to celebrate. They might roast their Slave-catching soldiery on the Common, and about the streets; and as the aimless, but not wholly inappropriate winding up of a day's Maine law dissipation,

docs.lead_paragraph: A Floral Festival. The old-time graceful customs bid fair to survive in one shape and another. One of these-the ancient May-day festivity--was celebrated in our vicinity this week, on a scale and with an enthusiasm that deserve a passing notice. utiful

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Legislative Committee on Building Associations. Collision on the Sound. Curoisity at Quarantine. A melioration of the Jews' Condition. The Poor in 1854 and 1855. City Truct Society. A Good Move. Creamer's Car Brake. A Boy Drunk--and Dead. Sudden Death. Clalming a Dead Horse. Good for Cholera. Police Items. The Lare Accident in Centre-street. Tried to Swallow the Evidence of his Guilt Small Theft. Nipped in the Bad.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Legislative Committee appointed to investigate into the condition of the different Building Associations in the City of New-York were to have held another session yesterday afternoon. Only Mr. DIXON, of the Committee, however, appearing, no business was transacted. Meanwhile representatives of various Building Associations were present and expressed willingness to submit to the most rigid scrutiny as to the conduct of their Associations.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Sunday afternoon last, Rev. R. M. HATFIELD, of the Washington-street M. E. Church, opened a temporary Tabernacle or Tent in which to hold religious meetings, on Union-street, near Hamilton-avenue Ferry, South Brooklyn--opposite the Union-street Mission.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President has called Gov. REEDER and other Kansas territorial officials to account for speculations in Kansas with half-breeds in violation of the acts of Congress, and tells him he cannot be kept in office unless the impressions now on his mind shall be removed by satisfactory explanations. Governor REEDER has promised to reply when he shall have reached Kansas. .
docs.snippet: The President has called Gov. REEDER and other Kansas territorial officials to account for speculations in Kansas with half-breeds in violation of the acts of Congress, and tells him he cannot be kept in office unless the impressions now on his mind...

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; ARRIVAL OF THE ST. LOUIS. Interesting Debate on the formal Closing of the Vienna Conferences. ILLNESS OF THE KING OF PRUSSIA. THE SPANISH INSURRELCTION. PARTICULARS OF THE BATTLE OF AZOFF.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the United States Mail steamship St. Louis, Capt. WOTTON, we receive intelligence from England and Europe to the 6th rest. The St. Louis arrived off Quarantine and anchored at 91/2 lost evening. The Royal Mail steamship Asia arrived at Liver pool on the 2d inst., and the United States Mail steamship Herman reached Cowes, on route to Bremen, on the following day.

headline.main: The Propoed Washington Banquet to Henry A. Wise.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a meeting heid in Washington by the friends of Hon. HENRY A. WISE, it was resolved to tender him a public banquet, to be given at such time as he might designate as most convenient and agreeable to himself. Mr. WISE has declined accepting this mark of appreciation on the part of his Washington friends in consequence of the impaired state of his health.
